titleStmt.title: An answer to George Keith's libel. Against a catechism published by Francis Makemie. : To which is added, by way of postscript. A brief narrative of a late difference among the Quakers, begun at Philadelphia.
titleStmt.author: Makemie, Francis, 1658-1708.

titleStmt.title: An answer to George Keith's libel. Against a catechism published by Francis Makemie. : To which is added, by way of postscript. A brief narrative of a late difference among the Quakers, begun at Philadelphia.
titleStmt.author: Makemie, Francis, 1658-1708.
Keith, George, 1639?-1716.
Mather, Increase, 1639-1723.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed, by Benjamin Harris, at the sign of the Bible, over-against the Blew-Anchor,

notesStmt.note: "An epistle to the reader" dated and signed: At Rehoboth in Pocamok Maryland. This 26 July, 1692. Francis Makemie.
"Christian reader" (p. [3-5], 1st grouping) signed: Increase Mather, James Allen, Samuel Baily, Cotton Mather.
"A true copy of George Keith's paper ...": p. 5-19.
Imperfect: tightly bound, stained, and cropped with some loss of print.
Reproduction of original in the John Carter Brown Library.
